titleInfo.title: Letter, Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould in Owosso, Mich., 1865 April 11

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated April 11, 1865, from Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould, Cherry notes the arrival of the news of Lee's surrender, saying "from every Fort around Knoxville demonstrations of joy were given in the firing of cannon." Expresses displeasure with Grant, arguing that he should now have "offered any other than unconditional surrender and then let Government show such mercy & leniency as might be wise & proper." Also speaks of the beauty of the area and the opportunities available for lawyers.

subject.topic: United States. Army. Michigan Cavalry Regiment, 10th (1861-1865).
